<script async>window.wf_pixel_generic_tiktok = data => {
  if (!data.id || !data.event) {
    return;
  }

 /**
 * This function returns the type converted argument when possible
 * @param {string} arg string argument
 *
 * @return {*} returns the correctly typed argument
 */
  const getRealArgumentValue = arg => {
    // number check
    if (parseFloat(arg).toString() === arg) {
      return parseFloat(arg);
    }

    //boolean check
    if (arg === 'true' || arg === 'false') {
      return arg === 'true';
    }

    return arg;
  };

  // constants
  /**
   * fetches the data type and converts the type if needed based on keyname extensions
   *
   * @param {string} key
   * @returns {*} returns
   */
  const getCorrectDataType = key => {
    let realValue = data[key];
    // get the keytype (array or singular string/number/boolean)
    let valueType = key
      .split(':')
      .pop()
      .trim();

    if (valueType.indexOf('[') === 0) {
      valueType = valueType.substring(1, valueType.length - 1);
      realValue = realValue.split(',').map(el => {
        if (typeof window[valueType] === 'function') {
          return window[valueType](el.trim());
        }
        return el.trim();
      });
    } else if (typeof window[valueType] === 'function') {
      realValue = window[valueType](realValue);
    }

    return realValue;
  };

  const areAllKeysSameLength = keys =>
    keys.reduce((length, key) => {
      if (length === false) {
        return length;
      }

      const valueLength =
        typeof data[key] === 'string' ? data[key].split(',').length : false;
      if ((length && length !== valueLength) || valueLength < 2) {
        return false;
      }
      return valueLength;
    }, 0);
  /**
   * creates a leaf object/array of objects to be added to the parent object
   *
   * @param {string} key parent key
   * @param {Array} keys array of keys
   * @param {object|undefined} defaultValue default value if provided
   *
   * @return {object|array} returns leaf object/array of objects
   */
  const setFields = (key, keys, defaultValue) => {
    const splittable = areAllKeysSameLength(keys);
    let returnObj = {...(defaultValue || {})};

    if (key === 'item' || (splittable && !defaultValue)) {
      keys.forEach(key => {
        data[key] = data[key].split(',').map(el => el.trim());
      });
      returnObj = [];
    }

    keys.forEach(key => {
      const value = data[key];
      const currentKey = key.split('>').pop();

      if (Array.isArray(value)) {
        value.forEach((el, i) => {
          const currentValue = getRealArgumentValue(el);

          returnObj[i] = returnObj[i] || {};
          returnObj[i][currentKey] = currentValue;
        });
      } else {
        returnObj[currentKey] = getRealArgumentValue(value);
      }
    });

    return returnObj;
  };

  /**
   * returns the full nested data object when called with a list of original keys and level = 0
   * recurses through the original keys and creates a nested object with levels from keys split
   * by underscores
   *
   * @param {Array} originalKeys array of original keys (strings)
   * @param {number} level current level in object
   *
   * @return {object} returns child object or object based on level
   */
  const getDataObject = (originalKeys, level) => {
    const returnObj = {};
    const {recurses, leaves, defaults} = originalKeys
      .map(key => ({
        splitKeys: key.split('>'),
        originalKey: key,
      }))
      .reduce(
        (result, {splitKeys, originalKey}) => {
          const currentKey = splitKeys[level];
          // If the level has more than 2, it means that this is not a leaf object
          // levels start at 0 and split keys will always have a minimum of length 2
          if (splitKeys.length - level > 2) {
            result.defaults[currentKey] = result.defaults[currentKey] || {};

            result.recurses[currentKey] = result.recurses[currentKey] || {
              keys: [],
              level: level + 1,
            };
            result.recurses[currentKey].keys.push(originalKey);
          } else {
            result.leaves[currentKey] = result.leaves[currentKey] || [];
            result.leaves[currentKey].push(originalKey);
          }
          return result;
        },
        {
          // parameters for recursive calls stored here
          recurses: {},
          // keys for leaf objects in the nested object stored here
          leaves: {},
          // default values for keys when applicable stored here
          defaults: {},
        }
      );

    // this creates an object with all the values from
    // keys and sets it to the relevant current key
    Object.keys(leaves).forEach(
      key => (returnObj[key] = setFields(key, leaves[key], defaults[key]))
    );

    // This uses recursive calls to create nested object
    Object.keys(recurses).forEach(key => {
      const {keys, level} = recurses[key];
      returnObj[key] = {
        ...(returnObj[key] || {}),
        ...getDataObject(keys, level),
      };
    });


    return returnObj;
  };

  /**
   * gets vendor objects from data
   *
   * @param {string} prefix starting phrase used to fetch objects
   *
   * @return {object} object containing all vendor data
   */
  const getCallObjects = prefix => {
    const dataObject = getDataObject(
      Object.keys(data).filter(el => el.indexOf(prefix) === 0),
      0
    );

    const callObjects = Object.keys(dataObject)
      .sort()
      .map(key => dataObject[key]);

    return callObjects;
  };

  /**
   * import async vendor script if not yet imported (uses window constant as a check)
   * this is currently also set in the tracking_helper script
   *
   * @return null
   */
  const asyncImportVendorScript = (pixelId) => {
    if (!window.ttq) {
      (function(w, d, t) {
        w.TiktokAnalyticsObject = t;
        var ttq = w[t] = w[t] || [];
        ttq.methods = ["page", "track", "identify", "instances", "debug", "on", "off", "once", "ready", "alias", "group", "enableCookie", "disableCookie"], ttq.setAndDefer = function(t, e) {
            t[e] = function() {
                t.push([e].concat(Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 0)))
            }
        };
        for (var i = 0; i < ttq.methods.length; i++) ttq.setAndDefer(ttq, ttq.methods[i]);
        ttq.instance = function(t) {
            for (var e = ttq._i[t] || [], n = 0; n < ttq.methods.length; n++) ttq.setAndDefer(e, ttq.methods[n]);
            return e
        }, ttq.load = function(e, n) {
            var i = "https://analytics.tiktok.com/i18n/pixel/events.js";
            ttq._i = ttq._i || {}, ttq._i[e] = [], ttq._i[e]._u = i, ttq._t = ttq._t || {}, ttq._t[e] = +new Date, ttq._o = ttq._o || {}, ttq._o[e] = n || {};
            var o = document.createElement("script");
            o.type = "text/javascript", o.async = !0, o.src = i + "?sdkid=" + e + "&lib=" + t;
            var a = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
            a.parentNode.insertBefore(o, a)
        };
      })(window, document, 'ttq');
    };

    window.argus_ttq = window.argus_ttq || {};

    if (!window.argus_ttq[pixelId]) {
      ttq.load(pixelId);
      ttq.page();
      window.argus_ttq[pixelId] = true;
    }
  };

  // functionality
  // global vendor script is imported in argus/footer, but if not, this function is a failsafe
  asyncImportVendorScript(data.id);

  const callObjects = getCallObjects('args');

  if (data.event && callObjects.length == 0) {
    // append a dummy empty event in case there is no payload to be sent for the event
    callObjects.push({});
  }

  callObjects.forEach(call => {

    if (call.sha256_email) {
      window.ttq.instance(data.id).identify({"sha256_email": call.sha256_email});
      delete call.sha256_email;
    }

    window.ttq.instance(data.id).track(data.event, call);
  });

};

<script async>window.wf_pixel_generic_nextdoor = data => {
  if (!data.id) {
    return;
  }

  /**
   * import async vendor script if not yet imported (uses window constant as a check)
   * this is currently also set in the tracking_helper script
   *
   * @return null
   */
  const asyncImportVendorScript = (partnerId, attribution_data) => {
    (function(win, doc, sdk_url) {
      if (win.ndp) return;
      var tr = win.ndp = function() {
        tr.handleRequest ? tr.handleRequest.apply(tr, arguments) : tr.queue.push(arguments);
      };
      tr.queue = [];
      var s = 'script';
      var new_script_section = doc.createElement(s);
      new_script_section.async = !0;
      new_script_section.src = sdk_url;
      var insert_pos = doc.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
      insert_pos.parentNode.insertBefore(new_script_section, insert_pos);
    })(window, document, 'https://ads.nextdoor.com/public/pixel/ndp.js');
    ndp('init', partnerId, attribution_data)
    ndp('track', 'PAGE_VIEW');
  };

  var attribution_data = {}
  if (data.user_email_hash) {
    attribution_data = {
      user_email_hash: data.user_email_hash
    }
  }

  asyncImportVendorScript(data.id, attribution_data);

  if (data.event) {
    ndp('track', data.event);
  }

};

<script async>window.wf_pixel_generic_commission_junction = data => {
  // check if call_name and enterprise_ids are missing
  if (!data.call_name || !data.enterprise_ids) {
    return;
  }

  // constants
  // argus pagealias to pageType mapping for CJ
  const pageAliasMapping = {
    'ProductPage': 'productDetail',
    'CheckoutReceipt': 'conversionConfirmation',
    'homepage': 'homepage',
    'SuperbrowseHotDeals': 'searchResults',
    'Superbrowse': 'searchResults',
    'Basket': 'cart',
    'Category': 'subCategory',
    'DepartmentCategory': 'department',
    'Keyword': 'searchResults',
    'DailyfairPDP': 'productDetail',
    'EventHome': 'homepage',
    'InspirationGallery': 'subCategory',
    'Gateway': 'accountSignup',
    'RegistryLanding': 'homepage',
    'Brand': 'department',
    'SolrEvent': 'searchResults',
    'Closeout': 'subCategory',
    'registry_application': 'accountCenter',
    'SearchOrders': 'accountCenter',
    'PicoMobileApplication': 'accountSignup',
    'Event': 'subCategory',
    'PicoApplication': 'accountSignup',
    'WayfairCard': 'accountCenter',
    'Help': 'accountCenter',
    'Clearance': 'subCategory',
    'Collection': 'subCategory',
    'OrderConfigurationPage': 'accountCenter',
    'BrowseByBrand': 'department'
  };

  /**
   * checks if all values in array are same length
   *
   * @return {Bool} true if values are same length
   */
  const areAllKeysSameLength = keys =>
    keys.reduce((length, key) => {
      if (length === false) {
        return length;
      }

      const valueLength =
        typeof data[key] === 'string' ? data[key].split(',').length : false;
      if ((length && length !== valueLength) || valueLength < 2) {
        return false;
      }
      return valueLength;
    }, 0);

  /**
   * creates a leaf object/array of objects to be added to the parent object
   *
   * @param {string} key parent key
   * @param {Array} keys array of keys
   * @param {object|undefined} defaultValue default value if provided
   *
   * @return {object|array} returns leaf object/array of objects
   */
  const setFields = (key, keys, defaultValue) => {
    const splittable = areAllKeysSameLength(keys);
    let returnObj = {...(defaultValue || {})};

    if (key === 'items' || (splittable && !defaultValue)) {
      keys.forEach(key => {
        if (typeof data[key] !== 'string') {
          data[key] = JSON.stringify(data[key]);
        }
        data[key] = data[key].split(',').map(el => el.trim());
      });
      returnObj = [];
    }

    keys.forEach(key => {
      let value = data[key];
      const currentKey = key.split('>').pop();

      if (Array.isArray(value)) {
        value.forEach((el, i) => {
          const currentValue = el;

          returnObj[i] = returnObj[i] || {};
          returnObj[i][currentKey] = currentValue;
        });
      } else {
        // if pageType, check for page alias mapping.
        if (currentKey === 'pageType') {
          // if there is no mapping, will return undefined
          value = pageAliasMapping[value];
        }

        if(value !== undefined) {
          returnObj[currentKey] = value;
        }
      }
    });

    return returnObj;
  };

  /**
   * returns the full nested data object when called with a list of original keys and level = 0
   * recurses through the original keys and creates a nested object with levels from keys split
   * by underscores
   *
   * @param {Array} originalKeys array of original keys (strings)
   * @param {number} level current level in object
   *
   * @return {object} returns child object or object based on level
   */
  const getDataObject = (originalKeys, level) => {
    const returnObj = {};
    const {recurses, leaves, defaults} = originalKeys
      .map(key => ({
        splitKeys: key.split('>'),
        originalKey: key,
      }))
      .reduce(
        (result, {splitKeys, originalKey}) => {
          const currentKey = splitKeys[level];

          // If the level has more than 2, it means that this is not a leaf object
          // levels start at 0 and split keys will always have a minimum of length 2
          if (splitKeys.length - level > 2) {
            result.defaults[currentKey] = result.defaults[currentKey] || {};

            result.recurses[currentKey] = result.recurses[currentKey] || {
              keys: [],
              level: level + 1,
            };
            result.recurses[currentKey].keys.push(originalKey);
          } else {
            result.leaves[currentKey] = result.leaves[currentKey] || [];
            result.leaves[currentKey].push(originalKey);
          }
          return result;
        },
        {
          // parameters for recursive calls stored here
          recurses: {},
          // keys for leaf objects in the nested object stored here
          leaves: {},
          // default values for keys when applicable stored here
          defaults: {},
        }
      );

    // this creates an object with all the values from
    // keys and sets it to the relevant current key
    Object.keys(leaves).forEach(
      key => (returnObj[key] = setFields(key, leaves[key], defaults[key]))
    );

    // This uses recursive calls to create nested object
    Object.keys(recurses).forEach(key => {
      const {keys, level} = recurses[key];
      returnObj[key] = {
        ...(returnObj[key] || {}),
        ...getDataObject(keys, level),
      };
    });

    return returnObj;
  };

  /**
   * gets call parameters from data
   *
   * @param {string} prefix starting phrase used to fetch objects
   *
   * @return {object} object containing all Commission Junction data
   */
  const getCallObjects = prefix => {
    const dataObject = getDataObject(
      Object.keys(data).filter(el => el.indexOf(prefix) === 0),
      0
    );

    const callObjects = Object.keys(dataObject)
      .sort()
      .map(key => dataObject[key]);

    return callObjects;
  };

  /**
   * import async vendor script if not yet imported (uses window constant as a check)
   * this is currently also set in the tracking_helper script
   *
   * @return null
   */
   const importAsyncCommissionJunction = () => {
    // script needs to be imported in order for window.cj data to be processed
    // There is no check for preventing the import of the tag multiple times because of this
    (function(a, b, c, d) {
      a = 'https://www.mczbf.com/tags/12032/tag.js';
      b = document;
      c = 'script';
      d = b.createElement(c);
      d.src = a;
      d.type = 'text/java' + c;
      d.async = true;
      d.id = 'cjapitag';
      a = b.getElementsByTagName(c)[0];
      a.parentNode.insertBefore(d, a);
    })();
  };

  // functionality
  window.cj = window.cj || {};

  // create array of all object arguments for function call
  const callObjects = getCallObjects('call');

  // check if the page is receipt page and don't fire non-purchase tags
  if (
    callObjects[0] &&
    callObjects[0].pageType === 'conversionConfirmation' &&
    !callObjects[0].orderId
  ) {
    return;
  }

  const enterpriseIds = data.enterprise_ids.split(',').map(el => el.trim());

  // if more than one enterpriseId, create array for call_name and push clones with each enterprise Id
  if(enterpriseIds.length > 1) {
    // check if each enterprise id has a corresponding action tracker ID
    if (!data.action_tracker_ids) {
      return;
    }
    const actionTrackerIds = data.action_tracker_ids.split(',').map(el => el.trim());
    if (enterpriseIds.length !== actionTrackerIds.length) {
      return;
    }
    // create array for call_name and pass clones of callObject into
    window.cj[data.call_name] = [];
    enterpriseIds.forEach((enterpriseId, index) => {
      // shallow clone object and add enterpriseId
      const callObject = {...callObjects[0], enterpriseId, actionTrackerId: actionTrackerIds[index]};
      window.cj[data.call_name].push(callObject);
    });
  } else {
    // else pass callObject with just enterpriseId
    callObjects[0].enterpriseId = enterpriseIds[0];
    if (data.action_tracker_ids) {
      callObjects[0].actionTrackerId = data.action_tracker_ids;
    }
    window.cj[data.call_name] = callObjects[0];
  }

  // global Commission Junction script is imported here
  importAsyncCommissionJunction();
};

<script async>window.wf_pixel_generic_html_element = (data) => {
  if (!data.tag) {
    return;
  }

  const URL_ATTRIBUTES = new Set(['src', 'href']);

  /* Example inputs/outputs
    Input:
      {
        tag: 'script',
        'attributes>type': 'text/javascript',
        'attributes>src': '//pixel.admedia.com/w.php',
        'attributes>src>ai': 17099,
        'attributes>src>ct': 'Purchase',
        'attributes>src>cv': 1998.99,
      }
    Output:
      <script src="https://pixel.admedia.com/w.php?ai=17099&ct=Purchase&cv=1998.99" type="text/javascript"><\/script>

    Input:
      {
        tag: 'meta',
        'attributes>name': 'facebook-domain-verification',
        'attributes>content': 'test-content',
      }
    Output:
      <meta name="facebook-domain-verification" content="test-content>
  */

  /**
   * inserts element with tag and attributes
   * not preventing duplicate insertions as that's possible for some use cases
   *
   * @return null
   */
  const insertElementWithAttributes = (tag, attributes) => {
    const newElement = document.createElement(tag);
    for (let key of Object.keys(attributes)) {
      newElement.setAttribute(key, attributes[key]);
    }

    const parentNode = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0].parentNode;
    parentNode.insertBefore(newElement, null);
  };

  /**
   * helper function that modifies object into a nested object
   * based on path split using '>' and value
   * uses children of URLs (starting with http) to set searchParams
   *
   * @param {object} object current object
   * @param {string} path current path
   * @param {string} value current value
   *
   * @return {object} modified object
   */
  const setValue = (elementAttributes, path, value) => {
    let keys = path.split('>');
    let last = keys.pop();

    // get object to update for path
    let toUpdate = keys.reduce((obj, key) => {
      if (typeof obj[key] === 'undefined') {
        obj[key] = {};
      }
      // adds current value as searchParam to existing parent url
      else if (typeof obj[key] == 'string' && URL_ATTRIBUTES.has(key)) {
        if (obj[key].startsWith('//') && !obj[key].startsWith('http'))
          obj[key] = `https:${obj[key]}`;

        let url = new URL(obj[key]);
        url.searchParams.append(last, value);
        obj[key] = url.href;
      }
      return obj[key];
    }, elementAttributes);

    if (typeof toUpdate !== 'string') toUpdate[last] = value;
    return elementAttributes;
  };

  let htmlElementData = Object.entries(data).reduce(
    (elementAttributes, [key, value]) => setValue(elementAttributes, key, value),
    {}
  );

  if (htmlElementData.tag && typeof htmlElementData.attributes === 'object') {
    insertElementWithAttributes(htmlElementData.tag, htmlElementData.attributes);
  }
};

<script async>/**
 * General Narrativ Vendor Script
 *
 * @author    Swati Satija <ssatija@wayfair.com>
 * @copyright 2020 Wayfair, LLC - All rights reserved
 */
window.wf_pixel_generic_narrativ = data => {

    if (!data.id) {
        return;
    }

    /* Example inputs/outputs
    Mandatory field to add is pageType when configuring pixels.

         const data = {
                pageType: 'CheckoutReceipt',
                'data1>ProductsPurchased>0': 'P12345,P678', 
                'data1>ProductsPurchased>1': '10,3', 
                'data1>ProductsPurchased>2': '2.5,1.5', 
                'data>order_Value': '123',
                'data>currency': 'USD',
        }
        Output:
          [{currency : "USD" , order_Value : 123},{ProductsPurchased : {P12345, 10, 3},{P678 , 3 , 1.5}}]
  
      */

    /**
     * This function returns the type converted argument when possible
     * @param {string} arg string argument
     *
     * @return {*} returns the correctly typed argument
     */
    const getRealArgumentValue = arg => {
        // number check
        if (parseFloat(arg).toString() === arg) {
            return parseFloat(arg);
        }

        //boolean check
        if (arg === 'true' || arg === 'false') {
            return arg === 'true';
        }

        return arg;
    };

    /**
     * fetches all the plain arguments from the data
     *
     * @return {Array} array of arguments to be put in the ire call
     */
    const areAllKeysSameLength = keys =>
        keys.reduce((length, key) => {
            if (length === false) {
                return length;
            }
            const valueLength =
                typeof data[key] === 'string' ? data[key].split(',').length : false;
            if ((length && length !== valueLength) || valueLength < 2) {
                return false;
            }
            return valueLength;
        }, 0);

    /**
     * creates a leaf object/array of objects to be added to the parent object
     *
     * @param {string} key parent key
     * @param {Array} keys array of keys
     * @param {object|undefined} defaultValue default value if provided
     *
     * @return {object|array} returns leaf object/array of objects
     */
    const setFields = (key, keys, defaultValue) => {
        const splittable = areAllKeysSameLength(keys);
        let returnObj = {
            ...(defaultValue || {})
        };

        if (key === 'products_purchased' || (splittable && !defaultValue)) {
            keys.forEach(key => {
                data[key] = String(data[key]).split(',').map(el => el.trim());
            });
            returnObj = [];
        }

        keys.forEach(key => {
            const value = data[key];
            const currentKey = key.split('>').pop();

            if (Array.isArray(value)) {
                value.forEach((el, i) => {
                    const currentValue = getRealArgumentValue(el);
                    returnObj[i] = returnObj[i] || {};
                    returnObj[i][currentKey] = currentValue;
                });
            } else {
                returnObj[currentKey] = getRealArgumentValue(value);
            }
        });
        return returnObj;
    };

    /**
     * returns the full nested data object when called with a list of original keys and level = 0
     * recurses through the original keys and creates a nested object with levels from keys split
     * by underscores
     *
     * @param {Array} originalKeys array of original keys (strings)
     * @param {number} level current level in object
     *
     * @return {object} returns child object or object based on level
     */
    const getDataObject = (originalKeys, level) => {
        const returnObj = {};
        const {
            recurses,
            leaves,
            defaults
        } = originalKeys
            .map(key => ({
                splitKeys: key.split('>'),
                originalKey: key,
            }))
            .reduce(
                (result, {
                    splitKeys,
                    originalKey
                }) => {
                    const currentKey = splitKeys[level];

                    // If the level has more than 2, it means that this is not a leaf object
                    // levels start at 0 and split keys will always have a minimum of length 2
                    if (splitKeys.length - level > 2) {
                        result.defaults[currentKey] = result.defaults[currentKey] || {};

                        result.recurses[currentKey] = result.recurses[currentKey] || {
                            keys: [],
                            level: level + 1,
                        };
                        result.recurses[currentKey].keys.push(originalKey);
                    } else {
                        result.leaves[currentKey] = result.leaves[currentKey] || [];
                        result.leaves[currentKey].push(originalKey);
                    }
                    return result;
                }, {
                    // parameters for recursive calls stored here
                    recurses: {},
                    // keys for leaf objects in the nested object stored here
                    leaves: {},
                    // default values for keys when applicable stored here
                    defaults: {},
                }
            );

        // this creates an object with all the values from
        // keys and sets it to the relevant current key
        Object.keys(leaves).forEach(
            key => (returnObj[key] = setFields(key, leaves[key], defaults[key]))
        );

        // This uses recursive calls to create nested object
        Object.keys(recurses).forEach(key => {
            const {
                keys,
                level
            } = recurses[key];
            returnObj[key] = {
                ...(returnObj[key] || {}),
                ...getDataObject(keys, level),
            };
        });
        return returnObj;
    };

    /**
     * gets Narrativ Object from data
     *
     * @param {string} prefix starting phrase used to fetch objects
     *
     * @return {object} object containing all Narrativ data
     */
    const getNarrativObjects = prefix => {
        const dataObject = getDataObject(
            Object.keys(data).filter(el => el.indexOf(prefix) === 0),
            0
        );
        const callObjects = Object.keys(dataObject)
            .sort()
            .map(key => dataObject[key]);
        return callObjects;
    };

    // functionality
    // global Narrativ script is imported in argus/footer, but if not, this function is a failsafe
    /**
     * import async Narrativ script if not yet imported (uses window constant as a check
     * @return null
     */

    const importAsyncVendorScript = (id) => {
        (function (window, document, id) {
            if (!window.narrativ) {
                var b = document.createElement("script");
                b.type = "text/javascript";
                b.src = "https://static.narrativ.com/tags/narrativ-brand.1.0.0.js";
                b.async = true;
                b.id = 'nrtvTag';
                b.setAttribute('data-narrativ-id', id);
                var a = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
                a.parentNode.insertBefore(b, a);
            }

        })(window, document, id);
    };

    const callObjects = getNarrativObjects('data');

    //Declaring the narrativ Object
    window.NRTV_EVENT_DATA = callObjects.shift() || {};

    if ((data.pageType != 'CheckoutReceipt') || (window.NRTV_EVENT_DATA["order_id"])) {
        importAsyncVendorScript(data.id);
    }
};try{window.wf_pixel_generic_narrativ({"id":"1176","pageType":"ProductPage"});}catch(e){}</script>

<script async>/**
 * General LiveRamp Vendor Script
 *
 * @author    Alex Kao <akao1@wayfair.com>
 * @copyright 2022 Wayfair, LLC - All rights reserved
 */
window.wf_pixel_generic_liveramp = (data) => {
  /* Example inputs/outputs
    Mandatory field to add is functionName when configuring pixels, to send events

         const data = {
                'call1>functionName: 'sendData', // comes from vendor
                'call1>arguement1': '123',
                'call1>arguement2': 'USD',
        }
        Output:
          [order_Value : 123 , currency :USD]

      */

  /**
   * This function returns the type converted argument when possible
   * @param {string} arg string argument
   *
   * @return {*} returns the correctly typed argument
   */
  const getRealArgumentValue = (arg) => {
    // number check
    if (parseFloat(arg).toString() === arg) {
      return parseFloat(arg);
    }

    //boolean check
    if (arg === 'true' || arg === 'false') {
      return arg === 'true';
    }

    return arg;
  };

  /**
   * fetches all the plain arguments from the data
   *
   * @return {Array} array of arguments to be put in the ire call
   */
  const areAllKeysSameLength = (keys) =>
    keys.reduce((length, key) => {
      if (length === false) {
        return length;
      }
      const valueLength =
        typeof data[key] === 'string' ? data[key].split(',').length : false;
      if ((length && length !== valueLength) || valueLength < 2) {
        return false;
      }
      return valueLength;
    }, 0);

  /**
   * creates a leaf object/array of objects to be added to the parent object
   *
   * @param {string} key parent key
   * @param {Array} keys array of keys
   * @param {object|undefined} defaultValue default value if provided
   *
   * @return {object|array} returns leaf object/array of objects
   */
  const setFields = (key, keys, defaultValue) => {
    const splittable = areAllKeysSameLength(keys);
    let returnObj = {
      ...(defaultValue || {}),
    };

    if (key === 'items' || (splittable && !defaultValue)) {
      keys.forEach((key) => {
        data[key] = data[key].split(',').map((el) => el.trim());
      });
      returnObj = [];
    }

    keys.forEach((key) => {
      const value = data[key];
      const currentKey = key.split('>').pop();

      if (Array.isArray(value)) {
        value.forEach((el, i) => {
          const currentValue = getRealArgumentValue(el);
          returnObj[i] = returnObj[i] || {};
          returnObj[i][currentKey] = currentValue;
        });
      } else {
        returnObj[currentKey] = getRealArgumentValue(value);
      }
    });
    return returnObj;
  };

  /**
   * returns the full nested data object when called with a list of original keys and level = 0
   * recurses through the original keys and creates a nested object with levels from keys split
   * by underscores
   *
   * @param {Array} originalKeys array of original keys (strings)
   * @param {number} level current level in object
   *
   * @return {object} returns child object or object based on level
   */
  const getDataObject = (originalKeys, level) => {
    const returnObj = {};
    const {recurses, leaves, defaults} = originalKeys
      .map((key) => ({
        splitKeys: key.split('>'),
        originalKey: key,
      }))
      .reduce(
        (result, {splitKeys, originalKey}) => {
          const currentKey = splitKeys[level];

          // If the level has more than 2, it means that this is not a leaf object
          // levels start at 0 and split keys will always have a minimum of length 2
          if (splitKeys.length - level > 2) {
            result.defaults[currentKey] = result.defaults[currentKey] || {};

            result.recurses[currentKey] = result.recurses[currentKey] || {
              keys: [],
              level: level + 1,
            };
            result.recurses[currentKey].keys.push(originalKey);
          } else {
            result.leaves[currentKey] = result.leaves[currentKey] || [];
            result.leaves[currentKey].push(originalKey);
          }
          return result;
        },
        {
          // parameters for recursive calls stored here
          recurses: {},
          // keys for leaf objects in the nested object stored here
          leaves: {},
          // default values for keys when applicable stored here
          defaults: {},
        }
      );

    // this creates an object with all the values from
    // keys and sets it to the relevant current key
    Object.keys(leaves).forEach(
      (key) => (returnObj[key] = setFields(key, leaves[key], defaults[key]))
    );

    // This uses recursive calls to create nested object
    Object.keys(recurses).forEach((key) => {
      const {keys, level} = recurses[key];
      returnObj[key] = {
        ...(returnObj[key] || {}),
        ...getDataObject(keys, level),
      };
    });
    return returnObj;
  };

  /**
   * gets LiveRamp Object from data
   *
   * @param {string} prefix starting phrase used to fetch objects
   *
   * @return {object} object containing all LiveRamp data
   */
  const getLiveRampCalls = (prefix) => {
    const dataObject = getDataObject(
      Object.keys(data).filter((el) => el.indexOf(prefix) === 0),
      0
    );

    const callObjects = Object.keys(dataObject)
      .sort()
      .map((key) => dataObject[key]);

    return callObjects;
  };

  const importAsyncVendorScript = () => {
    if (!window.dpmContext) {
      const liveRampScript = document.createElement('script');
      liveRampScript.src =
        'https://c.tvpixel.com/js/current/dpm_pixel_min.js?aid=wayfair-5f22736a-046c-11ed-b939-0242ac120002';
      liveRampScript.defer = true;
      const firstScriptTag = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
      firstScriptTag.parentNode.insertBefore(liveRampScript, firstScriptTag);

      // object where calls are stored if script is not yet imported (vendor provided)
      window.dpmContext = {};
    }
  };

  // functionality
  importAsyncVendorScript();

  const callObjects = getLiveRampCalls('call');
  let currentTime = new Date().getTime();

  callObjects.forEach((callObject) => {
    const functionName = callObject.functionName;

    if (!functionName) {
      return;
    }

    delete callObject.functionName;
    const callArguments = (callObject = Object.keys(callObject)
      .sort()
      .map((key) => callObject[key]));

    if (window[functionName]) {
      if (typeof window[functionName] === 'function') {
        window[functionName](...callArguments);
      }

      // save function call to dpmContext for webSDK to potentially call in the future
      window.dpmContext[currentTime++] = function () {
        window[functionName](...callArguments);
      };
    }
  });
};
try{window.wf_pixel_generic_liveramp([]);}catch(e){}</script>

productOverviewInformation.description: Give your home office a modern refresh with this desk chair. The bucket-style armless chair is made from molded plastic, making it easy to wipe down and clean. A padded, foam-filled seat cushion offers an inviting look and a comfortable feel when you're working long hours to get the job done. This task chair is set on a 5-star base with casters, plus the swivel seat, meaning you can easily move around your office. Also a convenient lever lets you adjust the seat height to suit your needs. Whether you're sitting in class, studying for a final exam, or working to beat a tight deadline, this stylish chair will keep you cool and comfortable throughout your busy day.

features.content: Simple & modern style with compact size: Easily matches rooms of all kinds of style
Multi-color options: complement your specific tastes
Double Wheel Casters & 360° swivel rotation: sturdy and very convenient to move when sitting on it
Easy to clean: with seat in plastic material, wipe the dirts very easily with a clean dry cloth
Easy Assembly: With assembling instruction, install this chair with ease
